page.title: 01Summary of the Meir area
page.content: The area is a mixed one,consisting of residential property and open countryside skirting the boundary of Stoke-on-Trent with Staffordshire Moorlands.The residential area of Meir can be classified as an Outer City Council Estate.Housing in the Normacot area is predominently Old Inner City terraced.New development has taken place at Parkhall with the construction of detached housing within the last ten years.Caverswall serves as a rapidly expanding dormitory village for the City. Features of note in the area are the newly reclaimed Park Hall Country Park and Caverswall Castle(Details are given). Industry in the area is mainly confined to the Pottery and Ceramic Industry located along the A50.
